RACE.RACE_TEXT: EVANGELINE DOWNS RACE 1 1M Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 10000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE DECEMBER 8, 2022. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since May 8, 2023 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CRIDER CHASE away in good order, dueled up front along the inside, garnered a larger advantage late in the final turn, held the runner up at bay the entire length of the stretch in a determined effort. GEORGIA DAWN stalked the two leaders in the three path, moved closer on the outside turning for home, could not get to the winner after an extended stretch drive. WHATS UP SWEETS in the second flight to the inside of the runner up, moved closer in some traffic between horses turning for home, flattened out through the lane. HARLANS WARRIOR broke out to bother SUFFRAGETTE, was straightened and moved up to duel into and through the first turn, continued to alternate for the advantage in the run up the backstretch, first to blink midway on the final turn. SUFFRAGETTE bothered at the start, trailed throughout and was never a threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Whats Up Sweets
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2nd flight, traffic, closer 1/4, flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Georgia Dawn
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3w, closer, could not get by

ENTRY.NAME: Crider Chase
ENTRY.COMMENT: away in good order, dueled, held foe at bay stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Harlans Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out, bothered foe, dueled 2p, 1st to blink

ENTRY.NAME: Suffragette
ENTRY.COMMENT: bothered start, trailed, never a threat

RACE.RACE_TEXT: EVANGELINE DOWNS RACE 2 5F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 11500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JUNE 8, 2022. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 8, 2023 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FORTY NINE MODEL with the early pace outside, vied three wide into the turn, dueled into the stretch closest to the inside, kicked clear through the stretch under a firm right handed crop. PUZZLING PRIORITY in the second flight up the backstretch well out in the strip, advanced four wide early turn, dueled outside the winner into the stretch, proved no match in the run to the wire, fully extended to save the place. BIND ON EARTH back off the pace and outside, moved closer four wide through the turn, continued to advance and was closing the gap on the runner up late. KNIGHTS SWORD with the pace along the inside for three furlongs, fell back off the lead pair by late in the bend, went evenly through the lane. BOURN with the pace four three furlongs while between horses, faltered when the real running began entering the stretch. SUMMERTIME BANDIT with the early leaders, steadied in tight quarters between horses with a half mild to run, fell back and did not threaten thereafter. PRAYERS SAVED fractious in the gate prior to the start, broke slowly, raced back, angled out five wide late in the turn, failed to make an impact through the stretch. GABY'S PROMISE remained back in failing to menace. FIRE OF GOLD with the early pace three wide, steadied from between horses into the turn, continued to fade in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Gaby's Promise
ENTRY.COMMENT: remained back in failing to menace

ENTRY.NAME: Knights Sword
ENTRY.COMMENT: with the pace along the inside, fell back late turn, evenly drive

ENTRY.NAME: Bourn
ENTRY.COMMENT: with the pace four 3/8 btwn, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Summertime Bandit
ENTRY.COMMENT: with early leaders, steadied, fell back 1/2

ENTRY.NAME: Prayers Saved
ENTRY.COMMENT: restless gate, off slowly, 5w into lane

ENTRY.NAME: Fire of Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: with the early pace, steadied, fell back 7/16

ENTRY.NAME: Forty Nine Model
ENTRY.COMMENT: with early pace outside, vied 3w turn, kicked clear stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Bind On Earth
ENTRY.COMMENT: back off pace, 4w advance late turn, getting to runner up

ENTRY.NAME: Puzzling Priority
ENTRY.OWNER: BW and HTS Stables LLC and Grudzien Jason G
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2nd flight early, 4w advance early turn,dueled,no match,saved 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: EVANGELINE DOWNS RACE 3 1M Turf CR: 58. Maiden Claiming Purse 21000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000, For Each $2,500 To $15,000 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SIKARA SIKARA allowed the pace to go early inside, moved off the rail while in hand onto the backstretch, ranged up three wide to challenge entering the stretch, put a head in front just past the furlong marker and drew steadily clear while kept to pressure. PAYTON'S INDIAN fractious prior to the start, pressed four wide early in the first turn, continued to prompt the issue the middle half, vied between foes upper stretch, could not match the winner the final furlong, clearly second best. STARSHIP NOLA last to leave, trailed early, saved ground through the second turn when moving a bit closer, shifted out a bit for the drive, up late for the show, not a serious threat to the top pair. LOVE CREED moved up to race with pace between foes early, showed the way up the backstretch in the two path, with the top two turning home then began to gradually weaken, caught late for the show. ZONG WAVE forwardly placed along the inside, had little for the drive. TIME TO CLOSE broke through the gate prior to the start, broke on top, flashed early foot for a half and gave way. MARDI GRAS GORMLEY also broke through the gate prior to the start, rank at the break and past the wire the first time, five wide through most of the first turn, fell back, trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Sikara Sikara
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed pace to go, ranged up 3w bid, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Zong Wave
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly placed inside, little for drive

ENTRY.NAME: Starship Nola
ENTRY.COMMENT: last away, trailed, saved ground 2nd turn, up show late

ENTRY.NAME: Love Creed
ENTRY.COMMENT: pace 2p, gradually weakened through the lane

ENTRY.NAME: Time to Close
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke thru prestart, early foot, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Mardi Gras Gormley
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke thru gate, rank start, 5w 1st turn, fell well back

ENTRY.NAME: Payton's Indian
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious prestart,pressed 4w1st turn, vied 3w,btwn foes,2nd best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: EVANGELINE DOWNS RACE 4 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 11000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000. Louisiana Bred Claiming Price $7,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHARLIE'S TOWN broke sharp, sprinted clear before a furlong, shrugged off a bit from the runner up late in the turn, clear again when straightened for home, fully extended to hold that same rival safe again late. THE FIVE B'S away in good order, chased the winner into the turn, moved closer late in the bend, fell back off that foe in upper stretch, roused, coming again late off the inside. MAJESTIC MANDATE broke back, lacked speed, came five wide into the lane, finished willingly to be in time for the show. NOCOMET in mid pack along the inside, continued one paced through the turn, steered out into the lane, improved position, not enough for the show late. TENOR lacked early foot, raced three wide through the turn, displayed some mild interest to better his position while not a serious threat. VEGAS GUY forwardly placed along the inside, weakened the final furlong. SIXTO last away, five wide into the turn, picked off a couple of tiring rivals late well after the issue had been decided. BYATHREAD in mid pack early, staged a steady retreat. MY LITTLE JUNIOR also steadily backed up.

ENTRY.NAME: Nocomet
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack inside, steered out, improved

ENTRY.NAME: Vegas Guy
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly placed inside, weakened final furlong

ENTRY.NAME: Byathread
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack early, steady retreat

ENTRY.NAME: Tenor
ENTRY.COMMENT: lacked early foot, 3w turn, mild interest

ENTRY.NAME: Majestic Mandate
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke back, lacked speed, 5w into lane, in time 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: The Five B's
ENTRY.OWNER: Bruno Jr Gerald Deville Carl J and Our Blue Streaks Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: away in good order, chased, closer late turn, coming again late

ENTRY.NAME: Charlie's Town
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharp, clear before furlong, clear again, lasted

ENTRY.NAME: Sixto
ENTRY.COMMENT: last away, 5w into turn, passed tiring rivals

ENTRY.NAME: My Little Junior
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadily backed up

RACE.RACE_TEXT: EVANGELINE DOWNS RACE 5 1M Dirt CR: 59. Claiming Purse 13000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MACEE with the pace while four wide into the first turn, cleared toward the inside onto the backstretch, long lead, given a bit of a breather second turn, stayed comfortably clear through the lane while kept to task. EASY ACT fell back to trail soon after the start, continued to lag the first five furlongs, began to move far turn, came six wide out of the final bend, finished willingly to be in time for the place, not a threat to the winner. COME WHAT MAE with the early leaders inside the winner and three wide, chased that rival the middle half, roused for the drive, could do little with that same foe to the wire, caught late for the place. AUNT JANA back off the pace, raced three to four wide second turn when improving a bit, flattened out in the drive. OVERLY SWEET broke in the air, raced back in lacking speed, made little impact. SING THE NOTES settled in mid pack along the inside, also had little for the drive. ATALANTA ASTERIA with the early pace, raced in the second flight onto the backstretch and was finished after five furlongs. LUCKY HARBORAGE was also through early, fell far back, jogged in, distanced.

ENTRY.NAME: Sing the Notes
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack inside, had little for the drive

ENTRY.NAME: Aunt Jana
ENTRY.COMMENT: back off the pace, 3-4w 2nd turn, flat late

ENTRY.NAME: Easy Act
ENTRY.COMMENT: fell back to trail, continued void of speed, 6w rally,willing 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Atalanta Asteria
ENTRY.COMMENT: with early pace, finished after five furlongs

ENTRY.NAME: Lucky Harborage
ENTRY.COMMENT: through early, jogged in, distanced

ENTRY.NAME: Come What Mae
ENTRY.COMMENT: with early leaders, chased, caught 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Macee
ENTRY.OWNER: Hernandez Earl J Hernandez Keith J and Duvieilh John
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace 4w into 1st turn, cleared, breather, kept to task

ENTRY.NAME: Overly Sweet
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in air and outward, lacked speed, little impact

RACE.RACE_TEXT: EVANGELINE DOWNS RACE 6 5F Dirt CR: 74. Maiden Special Weight Purse 34000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For Less $20,000).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ZINGING BAYOU within striking distance while four wide into the turn, continued in the four path through the bend, firm roused into the stretch, displayed good resolve late to keep coming and prove best. LIKE THIS set or forced the pace three wide continued to vie when applying pressure into the lane, late bid, between rivals, proved stubborn to the end. HEZA SEXY ZONG with the pace from the start, vied between horses through the turn, closest to the inside of the lead pack through the lane, also gave ground grudgingly. HARDLY ABLE with the early pace inside, began to weaken after three furlongs. STEAUXLIT off a step slow, lacked early foot, improved position with some mild late interest. CHARLIE'S PARADE broke back, came up empty while racing outside. JOSIE'S PRIORITY raced back off the pace and the inside, failed to muster a rally. COCAL fell back to trail after the start, was always outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Steauxlit
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slowly, mild interest

ENTRY.NAME: Hardly Able
ENTRY.COMMENT: early pace inside, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Heza Sexy Zong
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied early between foes, grudgingly along the rail stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Like This
ENTRY.COMMENT: set or forced pace three wide, stubbornly

ENTRY.NAME: Josie's Priority
ENTRY.COMMENT: raced back off the pace and failed to rally

ENTRY.NAME: Zinging Bayou
ENTRY.COMMENT: within striking distance, four wide turn,roused,good resolve late

ENTRY.NAME: Cocal
ENTRY.COMMENT: fell back to trail, always outrun

ENTRY.NAME: Charlie's Parade
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke back, empty outside

RACE.RACE_TEXT: EVANGELINE DOWNS RACE 7 1M Dirt CR: 82. Allowance Purse 35000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since May 8, 2023 A llowed 3 lbs. A Race Since April 8, 2023 Allowed 5 lbs. (Claiming Races Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HEZA PICKLE broke out, raced back and four wide through the first turn, continued to lag in the run up the backstretch, began to advance midway on the second turn, steered widest for the drive, finished with good determination to be in time at the wire. JEFFROW lacked early foot, raced four wide and just in front of the winner into the lane, also closed well to miss while between horses at the wire. BET AGAIN settled off the pace and the inside, came three wide for the drive, lodged a late bid inside the top two, not enough for that pair in the final strides while proving best of the others. CASH HOLIDAY in the second flight, ranged up to challenge three wide late in the final turn, vied past the furlong marker, outgunned late while also between horses at the end. VETERANS DAY prompted the early leader, moved up to duel with that one the middle half, held a narrow advantage past the furlong marker and proved stubborn until late. ROCK ON COWBOY set or forced the pace along the inside, faltered in the drive. PESO PESADO hopped at the start, moved up to race in mid pack for five six furlongs, faded through the lane. ALIGNED INTEREST rank early along the inside, was finished after a half, well beaten.

ENTRY.NAME: Cash Holiday
ENTRY.OWNER: Sebastian J Ronald and Sebastian Linda P
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2nd flight, 3w bid late 2nd turn, outgunned late

ENTRY.NAME: Rock On Cowboy
ENTRY.COMMENT: set or forced pace, faltered drive

ENTRY.NAME: Jeffrow
ENTRY.COMMENT: lacked speed, 4w into lane, missed btwn foes

ENTRY.NAME: Aligned Interest
ENTRY.COMMENT: rank early, finished after a half

ENTRY.NAME: Veterans Day
ENTRY.OWNER: World War IV Racing and Rebel Tide Racing, LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted early, dueled middle part, stubborn til late

ENTRY.NAME: Bet Again
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off pace, 3w into lane, late bid btwn, not enuf

ENTRY.NAME: Peso Pesado
ENTRY.COMMENT: hopped start, moved up to mid pack, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Heza Pickle
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out, back, 4w 1st turn, lagged, steered widest, in time

RACE.RACE_TEXT: EVANGELINE DOWNS RACE 8 1M Dirt CR: 67. Maiden Claiming Purse 10000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000. Louisiana Bred Claiming Price $7,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MIDNIGHT OIL broke out, was straightened to be forwardly placed from the start toward the inside, continued to track the two leaders up the backstretch just off the rail, patiently handled in some traffic second turn, moved out for the drive, challenged from the outside past the furlong marker and drew clear under steady handling. SHOETRICK four wide when back off the pace, advanced to a forward position before a half, challenged far turn, held a narrow advantage into the stretch, proved no match for the winner late, clearly second best. MIDNIGHT CROWN moved up to take control early, dueled before a half, disposed of that rival only to be joined by the runner up soon after, dueled inside that rival into the stretch and began to weaken, comfortably saved the show. R T'S IRON MAN settled off the pace, continued to race one paced into the lane, evenly to the wire. ST PIERRE void of speed for a half, improved through the second turn, no real threat in the drive. WILD FIST away in good order, set or forced the pace for five furlongs and began to give way far turn. SIMPLY WOW bothered to break back, was never involved. LAMONT off a step slow, was used four wide to advance into a position in mid pack, faded through the lane. SEXY IN THE GRASS stopped after a half, finished well back.

ENTRY.NAME: Sexy in the Grass
ENTRY.COMMENT: stopped after a half, well back

ENTRY.NAME: St Pierre
ENTRY.COMMENT: void of speed, improved, no real threat

ENTRY.NAME: Midnight Crown
ENTRY.COMMENT: early pace, headed, 2nd duel into lane, weakened, saved show

ENTRY.NAME: R T's Iron Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off the pace, flat through the lane

ENTRY.NAME: Midnight Oil
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly toward rail, patiently handled 2nd, moved out, bid, clr

ENTRY.NAME: Simply Wow
ENTRY.OWNER: Richards Corale A and Scott Bruce
ENTRY.COMMENT: bothered bit, broke back, never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Shoetrick
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w 1st turn when back, advanced,dueled, no match late,clear 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Lamont
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow, used 4w early, faded stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Wild Fist
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, set or forced pace four five furlongs, weakened
